intro: Dombeya brachystemma, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dombeya, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. Dombeya brachystemma is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
